oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copy print of Sgt. John Virgil Russell, Co. F, 52nd Georgia Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sgt. John Virgil Russell, Co. F, 52nd Georgia Inf. Regt., CSA enlisted in March 1862 in Clayton, Georgia. He was paroled on July 4, 1863 in Vicksburg, Miss. when Confederat troops surrendered to General Grant. After the war, he met Jacob and James Rowan from Hawkins County, Tennessee and traveled with them to Webster Valley. He married the Rowan's sister, Margaret Lucinda. This image was reproduced by a portrait studio in Knoxville, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Russell, John Virgil
